the eu's general data protection regulation (gdpr) aims to safeguard users' personal information and provide them with more control over how their data is used online. twitter has been fined for violating gdpr by the european commission, which serves as a warning to other companies that they must prioritize data privacy. additionally, twitter allows users to customize their settings to protect their data and manage what personal information is shared on the platform.</s> 
what specific actions can users take on twitter to protect their personal information and control how it is used?</s> 
users can take several steps to protect their personal information and control how it is used on twitter, including:

1. customizing privacy settings: users can customize their privacy settings to control who sees their tweets, direct messages, profile information, and more.

2. managing third-party apps: users can manage which third-party apps have access to their twitter account by revoking or granting permission as needed.

3. adjusting ad targeting: users can adjust their advertising preferences to limit the data that advertisers use to target ads to them.

4. monitoring activity logs: users can monitor their activity log to see who has viewed their tweets, which can help them identify any suspicious activity and take appropriate action.

5. reporting abuse or violation of privacy: if users encounter abusive behavior or violations of privacy on twitter, they can report it to the platform for investigation and potential action.<|endoftext|>
